source.e1a29e8c:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly_express as px

fig = px.choropleth(df1,locationmode='ISO-3',locations='Country Code',color='2005',scope='world',
                 range_color=(0,11000000),title='2005 Air transport, registered carrier departures worldwide',height=500
    )

fig.show()

source.fba36cbc:
labels=['Brazil','China','India','Russia','USA','Others']

plt.figure(figsize=(20, 20))
plt.subplot(2,2,1)
plt.title('Air transport, registered carrier departures worldwide', fontsize=10)
plt.plot(df_brisc1.iloc[:,[0,1,2,3,4,6]],label=labels)
plt.legend()
 
plt.subplot(2,2,2)
plt.title('Air transport, freight (million ton-km)', fontsize=10)
plt.plot(df_brisc2.iloc[:,[0,1,2,3,4,6]],label=labels)
plt.legend()

plt.subplot(2,2,3)
plt.title('Air transport, passengers carried', fontsize=10)
plt.plot(df_brisc3.iloc[:,[0,1,2,3,4,6]],label=labels)
plt.legend()

plt.show()
source.420b94df:
for df in [df1, df2, df3, df4]:
    df['Increase'] = df['2019'] - df['2005']
    df['Increase%'] = df['Increase'] / df['2005'] * 100
    df.sort_values('Increase', ascending=False, inplace=True)

source.18f2b660:
According to the above graphs, I understand that 'IDA & IBRD countries' or 'Middle income countries' have been contributing to the increase of transportation.
'IDA & IBRD' are categorized by 'lending' from WORLD BANK. And 'Middle income countries' are categorized by income. 
According to the website of WORLD BANK, both countries which are categorized in 'IDA & IBRD countries' and 'Middle income countries' are similar very much.
https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups

It means that the money from WORLD BANK have been boosting the economy of countries from low income to middle income. And as a result, it has been contributing to the increase of moving of products and people.
source.5bac6924: Actually, the transportation of China has been inceased very much from 2005 to 2019. But it seems that other countries or areas may be drivers of the transportation because the increase of 'Others' is very huge.
